title: [BUG] AutoETS update_predict fails if the test data does not overlap the train data
body:
**Describe the bug**
The `update_predict` method fail if the test data does not overlap with the training data. The following error message is printed
```
KeyError: "None of [DatetimeIndex(['2012-01-05 06:00:00'], dtype='datetime64[ns]', freq=None)] are in the [index]"
```


**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sktime.forecasting.ets import AutoETS
data = pd.DataFrame(np.random.random(1000), index=pd.date_range("01.01.2012", freq="1h", periods=1000))
ets = AutoETS()
ets.fit(data[:100])
ets.update_predict(data[101:110])
```

If the data overlap it will **not** fail:
```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sktime.forecasting.ets import AutoETS
data = pd.DataFrame(np.random.random(1000), index=pd.date_range("01.01.2012", freq="1h", periods=1000))
ets = AutoETS()
ets.fit(data[:100])
ets.update_predict(data[100:110])
```

Additionally it will **not** fail if for example ARIMA is used instead of AutoETS

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from sktime.forecasting.arima import ARIMA
data = pd.DataFrame(np.random.random(1000), index=pd.date_range("01.01.2012", freq="1h", periods=1000))
model = ARIMA()
model.fit(data[:100])
result = model.update_predict(data[200:210])
```

**Expected behavior**
As ARIMA, AutoETS will not fail.

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
I assume that the reason is that the new data are appended to the internal dataframe. Thus, in Line 462 of the tsa_model:
```python
            index = self.data.row_labels
```
has no frequency  anymore. (there is a gap in the indexes).
